RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH:
Possui Graduaчуo em Engenharia Agronєmica (UFPel), Mestre em Zootecnia - Forragicultura e Pastagens (UFLA) e PhD em Agronomia - Genщtica e Melhoramento de Plantas (USP-ESALQ). Pѓs-doutor em embriogъnese somсtica e fusуo de protoplastos (UESB e UEFS - 2007/2008) e em embriogъnese gamщtica (UNIPA/Itсlia - 2013 a 2015). Organizou e publicou trъs livros, oito capэtulos de livro, 12 artigos cientэficos, 12 artigos em revista (magazine) e um em jornal de notэcias. Щ membro do corpo editorial de revistas internacionais e revisor cientэfico (revistas nacionais e internacionais, agъncia de fomento e Universidade). Foi professor convidado na UESB, professor colaborador do curso de Pѓs-graduaчуo em Recursos Genщticos na UEFS e professora Adjunta na UNIFAL . Recentemente atuou como professora de genщtica geral e genщtica molecular na UNESP. Ao nэvel de graduaчуo possui experiъncia na ministraчуo de: biologia geral, genщtica geral, genщtica de populaчѕes, melhoramento de plantas, biologia e genщtica molecular, engenharia genщtica e trabalhos de conclusуo de curso (TCC). E, na pѓs-graduaчуo no ensino de genщtica de populaчѕes para os alunos do curso de Recursos Genщticos Vegetais. Possui experiъncia na coordenaчуo de: grupo de pesquisa Genщtica e Biotecnologia Vegetal (CNPq), projetos de pesquisa, projetos de extensуo popularizaчуo da genщtica (premiados duas vezes como melhor projeto na сrea de educaчуo) e o projeto de Ciъncia e Tecnologia. Alщm disto, possui experiъncia na coordenaчуo de eventos e orientaчуo de alunos de graduaчуo e pѓs-graduaчуo. Possui experiъncia nos seguintes tѓpicos de pesquisa: genщtica de populaчѕes, cultura de cщlulas e tecidos vegetais, embriogъnese somсtica, embriogъnese gamщtica, cultura de micrѓsporos isolados, fusуo de protoplastos, biologia celular, molecular e biotecnologia vegetal. Principais espщcies estudadas: Ilex paraguariensis, Penisetum purpureum, Passiflora spp., Oryza spp., Citrus spp., Corylus avellana e Olea europea. Interessa-se por pesquisas relacionadas a plantas, especificamente, sistema reprodutivo, genщtica e a biotecnologia, cuja atuaчуo permita o conhecimento e a compreensуo de genomas e dos mecanismos que regulam a expressуo gъnica a nэvel individual e populacional visando a produчуo de espщcies melhoradas e/ou a conservaчуo de plantas.

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN:
Has Degree in Agronomic Engineering (UFPel), MSc of Zootechny - Grasslands and Pastures (UFLA) and PhD in Agronomy: Genetics and Plant Breeding (USP - ESALQ). Post-doctor in somatic embryogenesis and protoplast fusion (UESB and UEFS - 2007/2008) and in gametic embryogenesis (UNIPA/Italy - 2013 a 2015). Has organized and published three books, eight book chapters, 12 scientific papers, 12 articles in magazine, and 1 news in a journal. Acts as editorial member of International Journals, is scientific reviewer of National and International Journals, Foundations that Supports Research and University. Was invited professor at UESB, collaborator professor at Post-graduation course of Genetic Resources at UEFS and, assistant professor at UNIFAL. Currently she is temporary professor of general genetics and molecular genetics at UNESP. At graduation level has experience in teaching the following disciplines: general biology, general genetics, population genetics, molecular biology and genetics, genetics engineering and conclusion works (TCC). At post-graduation level has experience in teaching population genetics to the students of the Genetic Resources course. Has experience in coordinating Genetics and Plant Biotechnology research group (CNPq), research projects, extension projects entitled Popularization of Genetics (awarded twice as best project in Education area) and the project of Science and Technology. Aside of that, has experience in coordinating events and mentoring graduation and post-graduation students. Has experience in the following research topics: population genetics, tissue and cell culture, somatic embryogenesis, gametic embryogenesis, isolated microspore culture, protoplast fusion, cell biology, and plant biotechnology. Main studied species are: Ilex paraguariensis, Penisetum purpureum, Passiflora spp., Oryza spp., Citrus spp., Corylus avellana e Olea europea. Is interested in research related to plants, specifically, plant breeding system, genetics and biotechnology, whose performance allows the knowledge and understanding of the genome and mechanisms that regulate the gene expression at individual and population level aiming species improvement and/or conservation.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Produчуo, propagaчуo e avaliaчуo de hэbridos somсticos de citros atravщs da fusуo de protoplastos
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Ferramentas biotecnolѓgicas desenvolvidas nos њltimos 15 anos vъm possibilitando a obtenчуo de novas combinaчѕes hэbridas em citros, atravщs do melhoramento in vitro. Em especial, a fusуo de protoplastos щ tщcnica que permite a uniуo de parentais diplѓides com o objetivo de regeneraчуo de hэbridos tetraplѓides com caracterэsticas complementares. Projeto dessa ordem vem sendo desenvolvido, desde 1996, no Campus "Luiz de Queiroz" da Universidade de Sуo Paulo, em Piracicaba, em cooperaчуo mњtua entre o Departamento de Produчуo Vegetal da Escola Superior de Agricultura "Luiz de Queiroz" (ESALQ) e o Laboratѓrio de Biotecnologia Vegetal do Centro de Energia Nuclear na Agricultura (CENA). O referido projeto recebeu apoio inicial da FAPESP atravщs do Programa Jovens Pesquisadores em Centros Emergentes (Proc. 95/9044-0), de 1996 a 2000. A FAPESP tambщm financiou diversas bolsas de PG para alunos dos Programas de Fitotecnia e Energia Nuclear na Agricultura, vinculados ao projeto. Os resultados obtidos atщ o momento culminaram na publicaчуo de diversos artigos e trabalhos em periѓdicos nacionais e internacionais e permitiu a formaчуo de mais de uma dezena de pesquisadores. Os hэbridos produzidos nos њltimos anos estуo sendo propagados para a instalaчуo de ensaios de avaliaчуo de campo, em competiчуo com variedades porta-enxerto atualmente utilizadas na citricultura brasileira. As etapas mais importantes do projeto podem ser resumidas, em ordem cronolѓgica, em: a) Propagaчуo das plantas hэbridas regeneradas e confirmadas a partir dos experimentos de fusуo quэmica por estaquia em casa de vegetaчуo; b) Formaчуo das mudas dos hэbridos somсticos e de porta-enxertos; c) Enxertia dos hэbridos somсticos e de porta-enxertos; d) Instalaчуo de ensaios de campo e avaliaчуo inicial do desenvolvimento das plantas enxertadas..

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
As atividades a serem desenvolvidas durante a Semana Nacional de Ciъncia e Tecnologia (SCNT) tъm como objetivo mobilizar a populaчуo, em especial crianчas e jovens, em torno de temas e atividades de Ciъncia e Tecnologia, desenvolvendo a temсtica Mudanчas climсticas, desastres naturais e prevenчуo de riscos buscando valorar a criatividade, a atitude cientэfica e a inovaчуo. Estas atividades objetivam disseminar em
Alfenas e regiуo o conhecimento, a reflexуo e a discussуo sobre a relevтncia, o impacto das pesquisas cientэficas e tecnolѓgicas e suas aplicaчѕes na melhoria da qualidade de vida da populaчуo, buscando despertar o espэrito empreendedor e a responsabilidade social. Ainda, com o propѓsito de atender as demandas das comunidades da regiуo a Unifal-MG estenderс as aчѕes da SNCT para o zona rural do municэpio de Poчo Fundo, distante cerca de 40 Km da cidade de Alfenas. Em parceria com o Ifet Sul de Minas a proposta щ o desenvolvimento de atividades com os associados da COOPFAM. Estes sуo pequenos produtores tendo o cafщ
como renda principal. Por outro lado, os impactos da aчуo humana na alteraчуo dos ambientes naturais propiciando desastres naturais e mudanчas climсticas tem na genщtica a base para anсlise dos impactos e no desenho de estratщgias de conservaчуo e restauraчуo da biodiversidade. Contudo, se manter atualizado nesta
сrea tуo importante щ difэcil pela rсpida evoluчуo das tщcnicas. Assim, foram incluэdos o curso de preparo de material didсtico para professores, palestras e filmes que fazem parte do projeto ?Popularizaчуo da Genщtica? com o intuito de atualizar e de ensinar o preparo materiais didсticos a professores de ensino mщdio e superior. Ainda, consta na programaчуo da SNCT, a exposiчуo ?Leonardo da Vinci: maravilhas mecтnicas?; do Museu de Astronomia e Ciъncias Afins, da cidade do Rio de Janeiro, para propiciar um espaчo de diсlogo entre as ciъncias aplicadas nos instrumentos cientэficos produzidos por da Vinci e o pњblico

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Tecnologia para a obtenчуo de haplѓides e duplo haplѓides (embriogъnese gamщtica) em Citrus sp e outras espщcies frutэferas (CsF 237072/2012-2)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O melhoramento de plantas necessita aumentar continuamente a produчуo agrэcola para atender a demanda de uma populaчуo mundial crescente. Melhoristas vegetais normalmente fazem uso de tщcnicas tradicionais e biotecnolѓgicas para criar novas variaчѕes genщticas com o objetivo de selecionar indivэduos geneticamente superiores com caracterэsticas que atendam aos produtores e consumidores. Recentes avanчos na biotecnologia proporcionam ferramentas para o melhoramento de plantas, entre elas, a cultura de tecidos atravщs da tecnologia haplѓides e duplo-haplѓide que representa um mщtodo atrativo para acelerar os programas de melhoramento. Esta tecnologia, atravщs da embriogъnese gamщtica de anteras e micrѓsporos isolados, torna possэvel desenvolver indivэduos homozigotos a partir de indivэduos parentais heterozigotos em um њnico passo, enquanto no melhoramento clсssico de espщcies arbѓreas seriam necessсrias, no mэnimo, de seis a dez geraчѕes. Considerando que uma geraчуo em species arbѓreas pode levar 10 anos ou mais, apenas este fato torna o melhoramento clсssico de plantas um processo extremamente demorado e de custo elevado em plantas perenes. Neste sentido, a embriogъnese gamщtica щ uma ferramenta indispensсvel para obter plantas homozigotas (linhas puras), especialmente em espщcies frutэferas como Citrus spp., Coryllus avellana e Olea europea por causa do seu genoma altamente heterozigoto, tempo longo de geraчуo, sistema de incompatibilidade, problemas de depressуo por endogamia, entre outros, que tornam difэcil e atщ impossibilitam a obtenчуo de linhas puras atravщs de mщtodos convencionais. Dentre as tщcnicas de embriogъnese gamщtica, o cultivo de anteras e micrѓsporos isolados tem mostrado resultados promissores na obtenчуo de plantas haplѓides e duplo-haplѓides para a maioria das culturas. Mas, atщ o momento, a cultura de anteras possui poucos resultados em espщcies arbѓreas frutэferas enquanto para a cultura de microsporos isolados nenhum resultado foi encontrado. Em funчуo disto, a maioria das espщcies frutэferas perenes sуo consideradas altamente recalcitrantes para esta tщcnica. Os objetivos desta pesquisa sуo desenhar e otimizar protocolos para produzir embriѕes haplѓides e duplo-haplѓides e, regenerar plantas nas arbѓreas frutэferas citros (laranjas, limѕes e clementinas), avelу e oliveira atravщs da cultura de micrѓsporos isolados para viabilizar a obtenчуo de embriѕes gamщticos e regenerar plantas haplѓides e duplo-haplѓides (linhagens) para atender o melhoramento de plantas e as pesquisas.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Plant breeding needs continuously increase agricultural production to meet the demands of the growing world population. Plant breeders commonly make use of traditional and biotechnological techniques to create and use new genetic variations in order to select genetically superior individuals with characteristics that meet the producers and consumers. Recent advances in biotechnology offer tools for plant breeding, between them, tissue culture trough the technology to obtaining haploids and doubled-haploids that represents an attractive method to accelerate breeding programs. This technology makes possible, trough gametic embryogenesis of anthers and isolated microspore, develop homozygous plants from heterozygous parents in a single step, while the classical plant breeding of tree species would be required, on average, six to ten generations. Considering that one generation can take 10 or more years, only this factor normally makes classical plant breeding a extremely long time and very expensive process in perennial plants. In this sense, gametic embryogenesis is an indispensable tool to obtain homozygous plants (pure lines), specially in fruit tree species like Citrus spp., Coryllus avellana and Olea europea because of its highly heterozygous genome, long generation, incompatibility systems, endogamy depression problems, between others, that makes them difficult and at least impossible to obtain pure lines trough conventional methods. Between the gametic embryogenesis techniques, the anthers and isolated microspore culture have shown promising results to obtain haploid and doubled-haploid plants in the most species. But, until now, the anther culture has few results in fruit tree species while for isolated microspore culture none results was recorded. Because of this, mostly perennial fruit species are considered recalcitrant?s for this technique. The aim of this research is design and optimize protocols to obtain haploid and doubled-haploid embryos and regenerate plants of the fruit tree species of citrus (oranges, lemons and Clementine), hazelnuts and olives, through anther and isolated microspore culture, in order to advance fruit tree research and make available haploid and doubled-haploid plants to attend plant breeding and research.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Avaliaчуo, Produчуo e Conservaчуo de Forragens

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
The experiment was carried out at the Laboratory of Tissue Culture at the Department of
Agriculture of the "Universidade Federal de Lavras", Lavras - MG, being evaluated the cultivars Mineiro, Taiwan A-147 and Pioneiro with plant growth medium consisted of Wood Plant Medium (WPM) vitamins; Murashige and Skoog (MS) salts. The medium was supplemented with 0.00; 4.44; 8.88; 13.32 and 17.76 mM of benzilaminopurine (BAP), with either 0.0 and 0.7% sigma agar. The elephant grass was micropropagated by secondary explant from axilary shoots. For the medium supplemented with 0.0 and 0.7% sigma agar, the best propagule proliferation occurred on 6.14; 7.21 and 6.2 mM BAP in solidified medium for Mineiro, Taiwan A-147 and Pioneiro cultivars. The best rooting occurred on
4.30; 4.44 and 4.02 mM BAP, on solid medium, for Mineiro, Taiwan A-147 and Pioneiro cultivars respectively, and the best plantlet height was obtained with medium without growth regulator in liquid and solidified medium.

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: KARASAWA, M. M.G.;GNIECH KARASAWA, M.M.;GNIECH, M.M.;GNIECH-KARASAWA, M.M.;Marines M.G. Karasawa;Marines Marli Gniech Karasawa;M.M.G. Karasawa;KARASAWA, MARINES MARLI GNIECH;GNIECH KARASAWA, MARINES MARLI;KARASAWA, MARINES M. GNIECH

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
The aim of this paper was to verify the variation in the loss of seed dormancy during after-ripening and the interspecific and interpopulation variability in the degree of dormancy of seven wild and two cultivated rice species comprising 21 populations and two cultivars.
 Methods Four wild rice species from South America, Oryza glumaepatula, O. latifolia, O. grandiglumis and O. alta, and two O. sativa cultivars were tested in one experiment. In a second experiment, five wild species, O. punctata, O. eichingeri, O.rufipogon, O. latifolia and O. glumaepatula, and one cultivated species (O. glaberrima) were evaluated. Initial germination tests were performed soon after the seeds were harvested and subsequently at 2-month intervals, for a total of six storage periods in the first experiment and three in the second. All tests were conducted in the dark at a temperature of 27 C. Key Results Different patterns of after-ripening among populations within and between species were observed. Conclusions The cultivated species (O. sativa and O. glaberrima) and, amongst the wild species, the tetraploids O. latifolia, O. grandiglumis and the diploids O. eichingeri and O. punctata, had weak dormancy, losing it completely 2 months after harvest, while O. rufipogon and O. glumaepatula exhibited pronounced dormancy. The latter showed different patterns of after-ripening between populations indigenous to the Amazon region
and those originating in the Paraguay River system. Seeds of Solim~oes (Amazon) and Japura origin showed weak dormancy whereas those of Paraguay origin showed deep dormancy. Ecological differences among natural habitats may be involved in such differentiation.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Desenvolvimento de mudas de Cafeeiro (Coffea arabica L.) irrigadas com сgua salina
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Development of coffee seedlings (Coffea arabica L.) irrigated with saline water

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: KARASAWA, M. M.G.;GNIECH KARASAWA, M.M.;GNIECH, M.M.;GNIECH-KARASAWA, M.M.;Marines M.G. Karasawa;Marines Marli Gniech Karasawa;M.M.G. Karasawa;KARASAWA, MARINES MARLI GNIECH;GNIECH KARASAWA, MARINES MARLI;KARASAWA, MARINES M. GNIECH

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: In the last decades, salinity has become one of the most important constrains to expansion of crop production to new areas, specially in areas with low quality water. Little information about the effects of the irrigation with saline water on coffee is available. Therefore, the objective of this study was to evaluate its effects in coffee seedlings, submitted to irrigation with different salt concentrations (0.0, 0.3, 0.9, 1.2 and 1.5 dS m-1). The measured variables were leaf area, plant height, shoot and root dry matter, shoot:root dry matter relation, leaf water potential, relative water content and nitrate reductase activity traits. In a broad sense, all variables decreased as salinity stress increased, except shoot:root dry matter relation. The results suggested that coffee plants at seedling stage were sensitive to salinity and growth inhibition became more evident when seedlings were irrigated with 0.9 dS m-1 saline water or higher.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: AGROBASE e AGRIS - Qualis Capes B2
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
The objective this study was to define the consistency of the culture medium that promotes the highest number of shoot and roots and explant height, for thein vitro propagation
of?Mineiro? and ?Pioneiro? elephant grass (Pennisetum purpureum Schum.) cultivars. Secondary (30 mm long) elephant grass explants, obtained through meristem culture, were
transferred to a basic MS medium, supplemented with WPM vitamins, 3% sucrose and 4.44 and 8.88 mM benzylaminopurine (BAP), for the cultivars Mineiro and Pioneiro, respectively.The treatments consisted of three different consistencies of culture medium (liquid,with 0.7% agar and 0.2% PhytagelЎ). The evaluations were conducted during 49 days. The number of shoots and roots per explant for both cultivars were similar
during the seven weeks of evaluation. Higher number of shoots and roots were obtained in culture medium supplemented with PhytagelЎ, intermediate with agar and lowest with liquid
medium. On other hand, for explant growth in height the studied cultivars were similar during the tested period in all used medium.At end of the seventh week of culture, higher number
of shoot was observed on culture medium supplemented with 0.7% agar and 0.2% PhytagelЎ. The highest production of roots occurred in culture medium supplemented with 0.2% PhytagelЎ. For the explant growth in height, no significant effect was verified for any of the factors evaluated.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Mating system of Brazilian Oryza glumaepatula Steud. populations studied with microsatellite markers
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Mating system of Brazilian Oryza glumaepatula Steud. populations studied with microsatellite markers

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: KARASAWA, M. M.G.;GNIECH KARASAWA, M.M.;GNIECH, M.M.;GNIECH-KARASAWA, M.M.;Marines M.G. Karasawa;Marines Marli Gniech Karasawa;M.M.G. Karasawa;KARASAWA, MARINES MARLI GNIECH;GNIECH KARASAWA, MARINES MARLI;KARASAWA, MARINES M. GNIECH

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
? Background and Aims A knowledge of natural populations? breeding systems is important in order to implement in situ and ex situ management and conservation practices. Using microsatellite markers, three Oryza glumaepatula populations from Brazil were studied to determine the breeding system and genetic structure parameters of this species. ? Methods Each population represented by ten families with ten individuals per family was studied using eight microsatellite primers. Families of the Rio Xingu population (XI) were obtained from the greenhouse, whereas families from Rio Solimoes (SO) and Rio Paraguay (PG) were collected from the wild. Amplified products electrophoresed on non-denaturing polyacrylamide gels were visualized with a silver staining procedure. The mating system parameters were analysed based on the mixed mating model (software MLTR) while genetic structure analyses of the three populations and their families were performed using the FSTAT software. ? Key Results The mean numbers of alleles per loci were 2.5, 3.9 and 2.5, respectively for the XI, PG and SO populations. Compared with their families, higher values for the observed heterozygosity and gene diversity were estimated for the parental populations. The subdivision (based on RST) and inbreeding (FIS) in the SO and PG
populations had similar effects, while inbreeding was the main effect in the families. Multilocus outcrossing rates varied from 0.011 to 0.223 in the three populations, indicating divergence in the outcrossing rates among O. glumaepatula populations. For the species (considering SO and PG populations together) an intermediate value was observed (t? m М 0.116). Biparental inbreeding varied from 0.008 to 0.123, contributing to the selfing rate in
these populations. More than 50 % of the outcrossing occurred between related individuals.
?Conclusions The results indicated divergence in the mating system among O. glumaepatula populations, with consequences for conservation practices.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Genetic structure of Brazilian wild rice (Oryza glumaepatula Steud., Poaceae) populations analyzed using microsatellite markes
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Genetic structure of Brazilian wild rice (Oryza glumaepatula Steud., Poaceae) populations analyzed using microsatellite markes

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: KARASAWA, M. M.G.;GNIECH KARASAWA, M.M.;GNIECH, M.M.;GNIECH-KARASAWA, M.M.;Marines M.G. Karasawa;Marines Marli Gniech Karasawa;M.M.G. Karasawa;KARASAWA, MARINES MARLI GNIECH;GNIECH KARASAWA, MARINES MARLI;KARASAWA, MARINES M. GNIECH

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Knowledge of the genetic structure and diversity of natural populations is important in developing strategies for in situ and ex situ conservation. We used eight microsatellite loci to estimate genetic structure and investigate within and between population genetic variation in eleven Brazilian wild rice (Oryza glumaepatula) populations. The study showed the following genetic diversity parameters: average number of 3.1 alleles per locus; 77.3% polymorphic loci; 0.091 observed heterozygosity and 0.393 gene diversity. F-statistics detected by microsatellite loci were: FST = 0.491 (and RST = 0.608), FIS = 0.780 and FIT = 0.888. No population was in Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium. The estimated apparent outcrossing rate (ta = 0.143) indicated a predominance of self-fertilization. The gene flow values were low (Nm = 0.259 and 0.161 for FST and RST, respectively). Populations were spatially structured but without a correlation between genetic and geographic distances. Five populations (PG-4, PG-2, PU-1, SO-4, NE-18) were identified as priorities for conservation strategies. Populations from the Amazon biome showed heterogeneity with respect to intrapopulation diversity (He). The high level of genetic differentiation between populations and the high number of private alleles suggested that sampling should be carried out on a large number of O. glumaepatula populations for ex situ conservation purposes.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Elevada diversidade genщtica interpopulacional em Oryza glumaepatula Steud. (Poaceae) avaliada com microssatщlites
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: High interpopulational genetic diversity of Oryza glumaepatula Steud. (Poaceae) assessed with microsatellites

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: KARASAWA, M. M.G.;GNIECH KARASAWA, M.M.;GNIECH, M.M.;GNIECH-KARASAWA, M.M.;Marines M.G. Karasawa;Marines Marli Gniech Karasawa;M.M.G. Karasawa;KARASAWA, MARINES MARLI GNIECH;GNIECH KARASAWA, MARINES MARLI;KARASAWA, MARINES M. GNIECH

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Microsatellite markers were used to characterize the genetic diversity within and among seven natural populations of Oryza glumaepaula. Six of these populations originated from the hydrographic basin of the Amazon and one from Rio Paraguay in the Pantanal Matogrossense. Using seven microsatellite loci, the following intrapopulation genetic diversity parameters were estimated on average: 1.98 alleles per locus, 56.2% polymorphic loci, Ho = 0.026 and He = 0.241. High interpopulational differentiation was noticed by examining Wright?s fixation index and Slatkin?s divergence parameter (FST = 0.715 and RST = 0.595, respectively), as well as a high level of total inbreeding (FIT = 0.963), greatly influenced by the mating system (FIS = 0.858). No population was in Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium, due to the prevailing autogamic mating behavior, as also indicated by the average apparent outcrossing rate observed: ta = 0.055. Consequently, among populations gene flow was practically absent, which has contributed to the high interpopulational genetic divergence. In general, very low or null outcrossing rates were found in the Amazonian populations. However, population PG-3 from Rio Paraguay, originated from Pantanal Matogrossense, showed a higher outcrossing rate (13.2%), indicating a mixed mating system with the predominance of self-fertilization. Since intrapopulation diversity was low, results indicate that sampling a large number of populations is the most appropriate strategy for the ex situ conservation of this species. For in situ conservation, taking in consideration the allelic richness, the following populations are indicated as priority: PG-3, TA-3, SO-17, and NE-7, from the hydrographic basins of the rivers Paraguay, Tapajos, Solimoes and Negro, respectively.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Comparison of microsatellites and isozymes in genetic diversity studies of Oryza glumaepatula (Poaceae) populations
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Comparison of microsatellites and isozymes in genetic diversity studies of Oryza glumaepatula (Poaceae) populations

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
The study of the genetic structure of wild plant populations is essential for their management and conservation. Several DNA markers have been used in such studies, as well as isozyme markers. In order to provide a better comprehension of the results obtained and a comparison between markers which will help choose tools for future studies in natural populations of Oryza glumaepatula, a predominantly autogamous species, this study used both isozymes and microsatellites to assess the genetic diversity and genetic structure of 13 populations, pointing to similarities and divergences of each marker, and evaluating the relative importance of the results for studies of population genetics and conservation. A bulk sample for each population was obtained, by sampling two to three seeds of each plant, up to a set of 50 seeds. Amplified products of eight SSR loci were
electrophoresed on non-denaturing polyacrylamide gels, and the fragments were visualized using silver staining procedure. Isozyme analyses were conducted in polyacrylamide gels, under a discontinuous system, using six enzymatic loci. SSR loci showed higher mean levels of genetic diversity (A=2.83, p=0.71, AP=3.17, Ho=0.081, He=0.351) than isozyme loci (A=1.20, p=0.20, AP=1.38, Ho=0.006, He=0.056). Interpopulation genetic differentiation
detected by SSR loci (RST=0.631, equivalent to FST=0.533) was lower than that obtained with isozymes (FST=0.772). However, both markers showed high deviation from Hardy-Weinberg expectations (FIS=0.744 and 0.899, respectively for SSR and isozymes). The mean apparent outcrossing rate for SSR ( =0.14) was higher than that obtained using isozymes ( =0.043), although both markers detected lower levels of outcrossing in

DETALHAMENTO-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-LIVRO: Evolution of Plants with Emphasis on Its Reproduction Form

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Chapter 1 of this book discusses the evolution of plants from the Pre-Cambrian era considering the starting time of alternation of generations. In the Paleozoic and Mesozoic eras, we will discuss the transitions from homospory to heterospory and the formation of the egg cell and the pollen grain as well as the evolution of seed plants. At the end of this chapter we will discuss the evolution of the angiosperms (flowering plants) and the sexuality transitions and the reproductive strategies. Also, the evolution of the unisexuality, self-incompatibility systems, selfing, and mixed mating systems will be discussed considering their evolutionary implications

At the end of this chapter we will discuss the evolution of the angiosperms (flowering plants) and the sexuality transitions and the reproductive strategies. INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Chapter 2 will discuss the biology and genetics of asexual and sexual plant reproduction. In relation to the asexual system, special attention will be given to the apomictic reproduction, where we will point out aspects of this system, as well as details of the knowledge about mechanisms and genes involvement. Regarding the sexual reproduction system, we will discuss details of this reproductive mode, the life cycle of plants, the gametophytic and sporophytic generation, as additionally to the control of genes in reproductive organs. Subsequently, aspects of the mechanisms that promote allogamy, selfing and mixed mating will be presented
